official-title.#text:
To achieve operational control of the international border between the United States and Mexico
			 through the deployment of members of the National Guard in support of the
			 United States Customs and Border Protection, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Activation and deployment of members of the National Guard to support Department of Homeland
			 Security border control activities along international border between the
			 United States and Mexico

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall order to
			 active duty, and provide for the deployment of, members of the National
			 Guard along such border to assist
in achieving operational control of such border.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
United States Customs and Border
			 Protection

text.#text:
At the request of a Governor of a State that shares a portion of the international border between
			 the United States and Mexico, the

At least 10,000 members of the National Guard shall be ordered to active duty and deployed under
			 the authority of this section along the international border between the
			 United States and Mexico. Members ordered to active duty and deployed
			 under the authority of this section shall be in addition to the number of
			 members of the National Guard so deployed along such border as of the date
			 of the enactment of this Act.

The deployment of members of the National Guard under the authority of this section in a State that
			 shares a portion of the international border between the United States and
			 Mexico shall continue until the earlier of the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
certifies that the Federal Government has
			 achieved operational control of such border.

text.#text: The date on which the Governor of the State withdraws the request made under

Members of the National Guard deployed under the authority of this section shall not be counted
			 toward—

header.#text: Exemption from end strengths and other limitations

text.#text: any limits on end strength; or

limits on the number of National Guard personnel that may be placed on active duty for operational
			 support.

term.#tail: has the meaning given that term in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 2(b) of the Secure Fence Act of 2006

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4882 IH: Southwest Border Protection Act of 2014
